title: Minimum Îµ-equivalent Circuit Size Problem
abstract: For a Boolean function f given by its truth table (of length $$2^n$$ ) and a parameter s the problem considered is whether there is a Boolean function g $$\epsilon$$ -equivalent to f, i.e., $$Pr_{x\in {\{0,1\}}^n}\{g(x) \ne f(x)\} \le \epsilon$$ , and computed by a circuit of size at most s. In this paper we investigate the complexity of this problem and show that for specific values of $$\epsilon$$ it is unlikely to be in P/poly. Under the same assumptions we also consider the optimization variant of the problem and prove its inapproximability.
